alert.note: Alert for Creek; Tulsa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 5:33AM CDT until June 12 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Creek and Tulsa. * WHEN...Until 845 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 533 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - One half to 2 inches of rain have fallen with an additional inch or so of rain possible before ending. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Sand Springs... Bixby... Sapulpa... Jenks... Glenpool... Mannford... Drumright... Kiefer... Mounds... Kellyville... Oilton... Shamrock... Keystone State Park... Jenks Riverside Airport... Liberty... Gray... Silver City... Leonard... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
